p: Enrollment samples with viral loads >400 copies/mL were available from 455 (90.6%) of the 502 index participants in HPTN 074 ( Fig 1). Results from HIV genotyping and ARV drug testing were obtained for 449 (98.7%) of those samples; 112 from Indonesia, 165 from Ukraine, and 172 from Vietnam. The HIV-1 subtypes identified were 60.6% CRF01_AE, 36.3% A1, 2.4% unique recombinant forms, and 0.7% B. The predominant HIV subtype in Indonesia and Vietnam was CRF01_AE (89.3% and 100.0%, respectively); the predominant subtype in Ukraine was A1 (98.8%). The prevalent HIV-1 subtypes detected were consistent with subtypes reported in Southeast Asia (CFR01_AE) and in Ukraine (A1) [ 24].
